what is cybersecurity: Cybersecurity is the practice of protecting systems, networks, and data from digital attacks, unauthorized access, and damage.
why cybersecurity is important: Cybersecurity protects personal data, financial information, and critical systems from cyber threats.
what are cyber threats: Cyber threats are malicious activities that attempt to damage, steal, or disrupt digital systems.
types of cyber threats: Common cyber threats include phishing, malware, ransomware, hacking, data breaches, and identity theft.
what is cybercrime: Cybercrime is any illegal activity conducted using computers, networks, or the internet.
examples of cybercrime: Examples include online fraud, hacking, identity theft, cyberstalking, and ransomware attacks.
what is data breach: A data breach occurs when sensitive data is accessed or disclosed without authorization.
impact of data breach: Data breaches can lead to financial loss, identity theft, and reputational damage.
what is hacking: Hacking is the act of gaining unauthorized access to systems or networks.
difference between hacker and cracker: Hackers may work ethically, while crackers perform malicious hacking.
what is ethical hacking: Ethical hacking involves authorized testing of systems to identify security weaknesses.
what is cyber hygiene: Cyber hygiene refers to practices that maintain system health and security.
best cyber hygiene practices: Use strong passwords, update software, back up data, and stay alert to phishing.
what is firewall: A firewall monitors and controls incoming and outgoing network traffic.
what is antivirus: Antivirus software detects and removes malicious software.
what is software update: Software updates fix security vulnerabilities and improve performance.
why updates are important: Updates protect systems from known security flaws.
what is encryption: Encryption converts data into unreadable form to protect confidentiality.
what is secure website: A secure website uses HTTPS to encrypt data transmission.
what does https mean: HTTPS means HyperText Transfer Protocol Secure.
how to check website security: Check for HTTPS, valid certificates, and correct domain names.
what is identity theft: Identity theft occurs when someone uses your personal information fraudulently.
how identity theft happens: It happens through phishing, data breaches, and social engineering.
how to protect personal data: Limit data sharing, use strong passwords, and stay alert to scams.
what is cyber awareness: Cyber awareness means understanding online risks and safe practices.
why cyber awareness matters: Awareness reduces the chances of falling victim to cyber attacks.
what is online scam: An online scam tricks users into losing money or information.
how to identify online scams: Scams often promise rewards, create urgency, or request sensitive data.
what is fake website: A fake website mimics legitimate sites to steal information.
how to verify website authenticity: Check URL spelling, HTTPS, and official sources.
what is social media risk: Social media risk involves oversharing personal information.
how to stay safe on social media: Limit privacy settings and avoid suspicious links.
what is digital footprint: Digital footprint is the trail of data you leave online.
why digital footprint matters: It can be misused for profiling or social engineering.
what is cyber law: Cyber law governs legal issues related to technology and the internet.
is cybercrime punishable: Yes, cybercrime is punishable under national and international laws.
how to report cybercrime: Report cybercrime to official cybercrime portals or law enforcement.
what is cyber safety: Cyber safety means staying protected while using digital platforms.
best practices for cyber safety: Be cautious, verify information, and follow security guidelines.
what is online privacy: Online privacy refers to controlling personal information shared online.
how to improve online privacy: Use privacy settings, VPNs, and avoid unnecessary data sharing.
what is cyber resilience: Cyber resilience is the ability to recover from cyber incidents.
why cyber resilience is important: It ensures continuity and quick recovery after attacks.
how to stay safe online: Stay updated, verify sources, and never share sensitive information impulsively.
